title: This dangerous botnet might have been taken down by a simple typo
description: A typo in a command given out to infected devices ended up crashing the botnet, researchers say.

title: Another top password manager is doing away with passwords
description: Fewer passwords to remember and easier logins promised with Bitwarden’s new passwordless authentication.

title: Adobe is ready to accept your AI-generated stock art
description: Adobe Stock has updated its guidelines for AI content and is taking a shot at dealing with messy image copyrights.

title: Micron's most advanced SSD yet should boost your next business laptop
description: Micron Technology unveils new solid-state drive (SSD), which it claims contains the first NAND SSD with over 200 layers.

title: Google is bringing continuous scrolling to desktop search
description: Google's "continuous scrolling" feature allows desktop users to view many more search results than ever.

title: Apple allows developers to set more price points in new App Store update
description: Apple announced changes to its App Store pricing structure, allowing developers to set prices in a more varied way.

title: Microsoft Teams is finally solving your most annoying PDF problem
description: Collaboration between Microsoft and Adobe is putting PDF document collaboration front and center.

title: Why MPB is the best one-stop-shop for all your photography needs this Christmas (and beyond)
description: Save money, give your beloved gear a new home, and upgrade your kit. What’s not to love?

title: Every multiplayer shooter needs a taster option like Valorant’s new Swiftplay mode
description: You can play a whole game of Valorant in 15 minutes now that Swiftplay mode has been added.

title: Rackspace migrates Hosted Exchange solution users following ransomware incident
description: Users continue demanding more from their cloud providers when security breaches occur.

title: The free Elden Ring update adds a PvP Colosseum in which to murder other players
description: Fight for glory as the Elden Ring update takes a gladiatorial turn, adding PvP arenas like those in the Dark Souls games.

title: Apple to allow Mac and iPhone owners in Europe to repair their own devices
description: It’s great to see Apple’s DIY repair route appear outside of the US, but it won’t be useful for everyone.

title: Open-source Linux utility is being hijacked to hack devices
description: Linux devices are being used to mine cryptocurrency, but can be used for more damaging attacks, experts say.

title: Apple Music Sing will turn your iPhone into a portable karaoke machine
description: Apple Music is helping you to up your Karaoke game by turning your iPhone into a karaoke machine with Apple Music Sing.

title: GoDaddy helps businesses scale online stores with new managed WooCommerce tool
description: Online sellers can put their feet up and have their store managed by GoDaddy.

title: Microsoft is trying another push to get people to switch to Windows 11
description: Windows 11 sales are still struggling in the shadow of Windows 10, but whose fault is it?

title: Chinese government hackers apparently stole millions in Covid benefits
description: Known threat actor defrauded the US government of $20 million during the pandemic, Secret Service claims.

title: Google Pixel Fold leak teases performance that could rival the Pixel 7 Pro
description: A supposed Pixel Fold leak suggests that Google's first foldable will be at least as powerful as the Pixel 7 Pro.

title: This cheap Bluetooth speaker may not be beautiful, but it'll make your calls clearer
description: ZVOX's new AV70 features its AccuVoice hearing aid technology to boost dialogue and cut out background noise

title: Intel claims it’s on track to regain chipmaking crown and leave AMD in the dust
description: Intel is markedly confident about accelerating the pace of future processor development.

title: Get rewarded for being a good sport in this year’s PlayStation Tournaments
description: DualSense Edge controllers and PS5s are among the takings in this year’s PlayStation Tournaments.

title: Hybrid workers are still causing major security headaches
description: Hybrid workers are still interacting with phishing emails, causing a lot of pain to their companies.

title: ChatGPT is now pretending to be a Linux machine
description: OpenAI’s ChatGPT goes all in, even executing Python code, creating directories and pretending to install packages.

title: Ukraine hails "priceless" help from Amazon Web Services
description: Ukraine vice PM hails AWS' work to keep the country online in the face of war.

title: Tis the season of Russian cyberattacks, says Microsoft
description: Sandworm is getting ready for an eventful winter, Microsoft is warning.

title: Overwatch 2 update: season 2 new maps, hero, and events
description: Here’s everything you need to know about the upcoming Overwatch 2 Season 2, from characters to skins and themes.

title: The Xiaomi 13 Ultra could rival the Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra for cameras
description: The Xiaomi 13 Ultra could have both quality and quantity, when it comes to cameras.

title: Microsoft is hiking the price of first-party Xbox Series X exclusives, starting with Starfield
description: Xbox takes a leaf from its competitors as Microsoft gear up to raise in-house game prices in the new year.

title: AMD RX 7900 XTX leak hints at a GPU that threatens Nvidia’s RTX 4080
description: Leaked benchmarks might make the rumored Nvidia RTX 4080 price cut more likely.

title: Do not fall for this dangerous Amazon shopping scam
description: Texts telling you you have an order that might not be yours are agressive and dangerous phishing attempts

title: Accidental Steam listing leaks Star Wars Jedi: Survivor release date
description: Ahead of its gameplay reveal at the 2022 Game Awards, EA's Star Wars sequel has seen its release details seemingly leaked online.

title: Nothing founder Carl Pei reveals company is working on new phone for the US
description: Pei hopes to take on Apple with the upcoming device, although it's currently hampered by American carriers and logistics.

title: Nvidia may be mulling an RTX 4080 price cut, but not because of AMD, it swears
description: The AMD Radeon RX 7900 XTX might be just what gamers need to bring down the soaring price of graphics cards, whether you're Team Red or not.
